Module it.polimi.ingsw

Package it.polimi.ingsw.exceptions

package it.polimi.ingsw.exceptions
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    it.polimi.ingsw
     
    it.polimi.ingsw.controller

  • Exceptions
    Class
    Description
    CharacterCardAlreadyPlayedException
    This exception is thrown if a player tries to play a Character Card in a round in which they have already played one.
    CharacterCardNotFoundException
    This exception is thrown if a player tries to play a Character Card with an unknown ID (which means that the ID may be below 1 or over 12 or the card corresponding to that ID may not be currently present in the match).
    EmptyBagException
    This exception is thrown if the game controller runs out of students while trying to refill clouds or Character Cards.
    EmptyCloudException
    This exception is thrown if a players tries to empty a cloud that is already empty (in other words, if they try to choose a cloud already chosen in a certain round).
    FullTableException
    This exception is thrown if a player tries to move a student to a table, but the corresponding table has no spaces left.
    InvalidNumberOfStepsException
    This exception is thrown if a player tries to make Mother Nature move of a number of steps they are not allowed to.
    IslandNotFoundException
    This exception is thrown if a player provides an island ID that is not corresponding to any of the existing ones.
    NonExistentColorException
    This exception is thrown if a player manages to provide a table color that is not present in the game.
    NotEnoughCoinsException
    This exception is thrown if a player tries to play a Character Card, but they don't afford it.
    NoVetoTilesException
    This exception is thrown if a player tries to use the Healer Character Card, but the game board has no more veto tiles available.
    StudentNotFoundException
    This exception is thrown if a player tries to move a student that is not where stated.
    TieException
    This exception is thrown in the rare case a game ends in perfect tie (specifically, two or more players share the same amount of towers left and the same amount of professors owned at the same time).
    TryAgainException
    This exception is the super-class of every custom exception (except TieException).
    WrongMessageSentException
    This exception is thrown if the message received from a client is not of one of the types expected by the controller (or by the server).
    WrongTurnException
    This exception is thrown if a client manages to send the server (and consequently the controller) a message of an expected type, but not during the game round they are allowed to.
